div.head: CHAP. CXXXVIII.
1 Dauid praiseth God for the truth of his word. 4 He prophecieth that the kings of the earth shall praise God. 7 He professeth his confidence in God.
div.ab: [A Psalme of Dauid.] I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise vnto thee. Psal.119. 4.6.
I will worship towards thy holy temple, and praise thy name, for thy louing kindnesse and for thy trueth: for thou hast magnified thy word aboue all thy name.
In the day when I cried, thou answeredst me: and strengthenedst me with strength in my soule.
All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O Lord: when they heare the words of thy mouth.
div.fw: Nothing secret to the eyes of God.
div.ab: Yea they shall sing in the wayes of the Lord: for great is the glory of the Lord.
Though the Lord be high, yet hath he respect vnto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afarre off.
Though I walke in the mids of trouble, thou wilt reuiue me, thou shalt stretch foorth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies: and thy right hand shall saue me.
The Lord wil perfit that which concerneth me: thy mercie, O Lord, endureth for euer: forsake not the works of thine owne hands.
